China

In the misty mountains of the East, dessert is an art form perfected over millennia. Every bite carries the weight of dynastic tradition and the precision of master craftsmen.

Mooncakes

Lotus paste and salted egg yolk encased in delicate pastry, stamped with intricate patterns. A festival in every bite.

Tangyuan

Glutinous rice balls in warm, sweet ginger syrup. Roundness symbolizes family reunion.
